ui
Class StringVerifier

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.InputVerifier
      ui.StringVerifier

public class StringVerifier
extends javax.swing.InputVerifier

Checks for valid input in Strings. It does this via a regular expression from AllowableInputType and with a minimum and maximum length.

Version:
0.1 Coby Viner, March 3, 2012
Author:
Coby Viner

StringVerifier

Constructor.

StringVerifier

public StringVerifier(int min,
                      int max,
                      AllowableInputType inputType,
                      java.lang.String invalidMessage,
                      java.awt.Component parent)
Constructor. Use this to specify an error message if invalid input is given. Note that usage of this causes the verify(JComponent) to have the side-effect of displaying an error dialogue when erroneous input is provided.

Parameters:
min - The minimum length
max - The maximum length
inputType - See AllowableInputType
invalidMessage - The message to display when erroneous input is provided
parent - The parent GUI component requesting input verification
Method Detail

isCorrectLength

private boolean isCorrectLength(java.lang.String text)
Checks if the text is of the correct length.

Parameters:
text - The text whose length is checked
Returns:
True iff the text is of the correct length
